This is scheduled for `4.0` (see the Milestone link on the right panel), so this will need to wait a bit. ðŸ‘

issue.title: Extend pytest.approx to handle strings.

labels.name: type: proposal
labels.description: proposal for a new feature, often to gather opinions or design the API around the new feature

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
This issue is a developer and community discussion on how strings should be handled in pytest.approx()

Two of the easiest ways to do text matching in pytest are:

1. Regex Matching
2. `assert "abc" in "abcdef"` 

I enjoy the benefits that using `assert` gives me because of its strength in pytest, but It's not as flexible as Regex could possibly be. 

A handy use case I could see is checking to see if an expected string is close to a "template"

### psudo-code###
```
template = "You have saved {%} record"
returned_string = "You have saved 10 records"
approx(returned_string, template) -> true
```

perhaps there is a bounds of some sort

```
template = "You have saved {%} record"
returned_string = "You have saved 7 records"
bounds = [0, 10]
approx(returned_string, template, bounds) -> true

bounds = [0,5]
approx(returned_string, template, bounds) -> false
```

It seems that a template/bounds combo seems to be a good way to extend string comparison beyond the `substring in string` model. 

I am very eager to think about other ideas or use cases people have ðŸ˜„

issue.title: Remove record_xml_property and support for strings in pytest.main()

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
This removes:

* `record_xml_property`
* string support in `pytest.main()`

Decided to open a single PR because the set of changes is small, but note that each feature was removed in their own commit.

Fix #3085, Fix #4547
